network.title: Network protocol
network.description: Protocol for starting and stopping FBP networks, and finding out about their state.

stopped.title: Stopped
stopped.description: Inform that a given network has stopped.

time.title: Time
time.description: time when the network was stopped

uptime.title: Uptime
uptime.description: time the network was running, in seconds

started.title: Started
started.description: Inform that a given network has been started.

time.title: Time
time.description: time when the network was started

running.title: Running
running.description: boolean tells whether the network is running or not

uptime.title: Uptime
uptime.description: (optional) time the network has been running, in seconds

output.description: An output message from a running network, roughly similar to STDOUT output of a Unix process, or a line of console.log in JavaScript. Output can also be used for passing images from the runtime to the UI.

type.description: (optional) type of output, either message or previewurl

url.description: (optional) URL for an image generated by the runtime

error.description: An error from a running network, roughly similar to STDERR output of a Unix process, or a line of console.error in JavaScript.

icon.description: Icon of a component instance has changed.
new icon for the component instance

connect.description: Beginning of transmission on an edge.

id.description: textual edge identifier, usually in form of a FBP language line

subgraph.description: (optional): subgraph identifier for the event. An array of node IDs

begingroup.description: Beginning of a group (bracket IP) on an edge.

id.description: textual edge identifier, usually in form of a FBP language line

subgraph.description: (optional): subgraph identifier for the event. An array of node IDs

id.description: textual edge identifier, usually in form of a FBP language line

data.description: actual data being transmitted, encoded in a way that can be carried over the protocol transport

subgraph.description: (optional): subgraph identifier for the event. An array of node IDs

endgroup.description: Ending of a group (bracket IP) on an edge.

id.description: textual edge identifier, usually in form of a FBP language line

subgraph.description: (optional): subgraph identifier for the event. An array of node IDs

disconnect.description: End of transmission on an edge.

id.description: textual edge identifier, usually in form of a FBP language line

subgraph.description: (optional): subgraph identifier for the event. An array of node IDs

start.description: Start execution of a FBP network based on a given graph.

getstatus.description: Get the current status of the runtime. The runtime should respond with a status message.

stop.description: Stop execution of a FBP network based on a given graph.

edges.description: List of edges user has selected for inspection in a user interface or debugger, sent from UI to a runtime.
list of selected edges, each containing

component.title: Component protocol
component.description: Protocol for handling the component registry.

component.title: Component
component.description: Transmit the metadata about a component instance.

name.title: Name
name.description: component name in format that can be used in graphs

description.title: Description
description.description: (optional) textual description on what the component does

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: (optional): visual icon for the component, matching icon names in [Font Awesome](http://fortawesome.github.io/Font-Awesome/icons/)

subgraph.title: Subgraph
subgraph.description: boolean telling whether the component is a subgraph

inPorts.title: Input Ports
inPorts.description: list of input ports, each containing:

addressable.title: Addressable
addressable.description: boolean telling whether the port is an ArrayPort

required.title: Required
required.description: boolean telling whether the port needs to be connected for the component to work

values.title: Values
values.description: (optional) array of the values that the port accepts for enum ports

default.title: Default
default.description: (optional) the default value received by the port

addressable.title: Addressable
addressable.description: boolean telling whether the port is an ArrayPort

required.title: Required
required.description: boolean telling whether the port needs to be connected for the component to work

source.description: Source code for a component. In cases where a runtime receives a `source` message, it should do whatever operations are needed for making that component available for graphs, including possible compilation.

language.title: Language
language.description: The programming language used for the component code, for example `coffeescript`

list.title: List
list.description: Request a list of currently available components. Will be responded with a set of `component` messages.

getsource.title: Get Source
getsource.description: Request for the source code of a given component. Will be responded with a `source` message.

name.description: Name of the component to get source code for

source.title: Source code
source.description: Source code for a component. In cases where a runtime receives a `source` message, it should do whatever operations are needed for making that component available for graphs, including possible compilation.

language.title: Language
language.description: The programming language used for the component code, for example `coffeescript`

runtime.title: Runtime protocol
runtime.description: When a client connects to a FBP procotol it may choose to discover the capabilities and other information about the runtime.

getruntime.title: Get runtime
getruntime.description: Request the information about the runtime. When receiving this message the runtime should response with a runtime message.

packet.title: Packet
packet.description:
Runtimes that can be used as remote subgraphs (i.e. ones that have reported supporting the protocol:runtime capability) need to be able to receive and transmit information packets at their exposed ports.
These packets can be send from the client to the runtime's input ports, or from runtime's output ports to the client.

port.title: Port
port.description: port name for the input or output port

payload.title: Payload
payload.description: (optional) payload for the packet. Used only with begingroup (for group names) and data packets

ports.title: Ports
ports.description: Message sent by the runtime to signal its available ports. The runtime is responsible for sending the up-to-date list of available ports back to client whenever it changes.

graph.title: Graph
graph.description: ID of the currently configured main graph running on the runtime

addressable.title: addressable
addressable.description: boolean telling whether the port is an ArrayPort

required.title: Required
required.description: boolean telling whether the port needs to be connected for the component to work
boolean telling whether the port needs to be connected for the component to work

addressable.description: boolean telling whether the port is an ArrayPort

runtime.title: Runtime
runtime.description: Response from the runtime to the getruntime request.

id.title: ID
id.description: (optional) runtime ID used with Flowhub Registry

version.title: Version
version.description: version of the runtime protocol that the runtime supports, for example 0.4

capabilities.title: Capabilities

protocol:network.description: the runtime is able to control and introspect its running networks using the Network protocol

protocol:component.description: the runtime is able to list and modify its components using the Component protocol

protocol:runtime.description: the runtime is able to expose the ports of its main graph using the Runtime protocol and transmit packet information to/from them

component:getsource.description: runtime is able to read and send component source code back to client

network:persist.description: runtime is able to *flash* a running graph setup into itself, making it persistent across reboots

protocol:graph.description: the runtime is able to modify its graphs using the Graph protocol

component:setsource.description: runtime is able to compile and run custom components sent as source code strings

capabilities.description:
array of capability strings for things the runtime is able to do
If the runtime is currently running a graph and it is able to speak the full Runtime protocol, it should follow up with a ports message.

graph.title: Graph
graph.description: (optional) ID of the currently configured main graph running on the runtime, if any

type.title: Type
type.description: type of the runtime, for example noflo-nodejs or microflo

graph.title: Graph protocol
graph.description: This protocol is utilized for communicating about graph changes in both directions.

component.title: Component
component.description: component name used for the node

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: (optional): structure of key-value pairs for node metadata

removenode.description: Remove a node from a graph.

renamenode.description: Change the ID of a node in the graph

changenode.title: Change node
changenode.description: Change the metadata associated to a node in the graph

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: structure of key-value pairs for node metadata

addedge.description: Add an edge to the graph

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: (optional): structure of key-value pairs for edge metadata

removeedge.title: Remove edge
removeedge.description: Remove an edge from the graph

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: struct of key-value pairs for edge metadata

addinitial.title: Add initial
addinitial.description: Add an IIP to the graph

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: (optional): structure of key-value pairs for edge metadata

data.title: Data
data.description: IIP value in its actual data type

removeinitial.title: Remove initial
removeinitial.description: Remove an IIP from the graph

addinport.description: Add an exported inport to the graph.

public.title: Public
public.description: the exported name of the port

metadata.description: (optional): structure of key-value pairs for node metadata

removeinport.description: Remove an exported port from the graph

renameinport.description: Rename an exported port in the graph

addgroup.title: Add group
addgroup.description: Add a group to the graph

nodes.title: Nodes
nodes.description: an array of node ids part of the group

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: (optional): structure of key-value pairs for group metadata

removegroup.title: Remove group
removegroup.description: Remove a group from the graph

renamegroup.title: Rename group
renamegroup.description: Rename a group in the graph.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: structure of key-value pairs for group metadata

id.title: ID
id.description: identifier for the graph being created. Used for all subsequent messages related to the graph instance

main.title: Main
main.description:
(optional) Identifies the graph as a main graph of a project that should not be registered as a component
Graphs registered in this way should also be available for use as subgraphs in other graphs. Therefore a graph registration and later changes to it may cause component messages of the Component protocol to be sent back to the client informing of possible changes in the ports of the subgraph component.
